resources.string: Daily Dose of Motivation\n(Not yet uploaded)
Practice for 10-15 minutes daily.\nYou can extend it to 40-45 minutes Daily.

Find a comfortable seated position, either on the floor or on a chair, with your back straight.
Relax your hands on your thighs or knees, palms facing upward.
Bring the tips of your middle and ring fingers to touch the tip of your thumb, while keeping your index and little fingers extended.
Maintain a gentle pressure between the fingers, but not too tight.
Rest your hands on your thighs or allow them to relax in you.

Slowly separate your fingers and let your hands relax naturally.
You can shake out your hands or roll your wrists gently after releasing the mudra.
Take a moment to observe any changes or sensations you may feel in your body and mind.
Breathe deeply and notice how the practice has affected you.
Digestive support, Menstrual and reproductive health, energy flow. \nBalances energy, relieves stress, promotes stability.

Sign Up to discover amazing things around you

Madhav Sewa Society is a non-governmental organization (NGO) dedicated to making a positive impact on the lives of disabled individuals and children in need. Founded with a vision of fostering inclusivity and providing educational opportunities, the organization strives to create a society where every person, regardless of their abilities, can lead a fulfilling life.

Madhav Sewa Society is committed to supporting disabled individuals by offering a range of services and initiatives. Their primary focus is on improving the quality of life for people with disabilities through various means. The organization provides access to medical resources, rehabilitation programs, and assistive devices to enhance mobility and independence. They also offer counseling and emotional support to individuals and their families, recognizing the importance of mental well-being in the overall development and empowerment of disabled persons.

Recognizing the significance of education in shaping a bright future, Madhav Sewa Society runs free tuition classes for children from underprivileged backgrounds. These classes aim to bridge the educational gap and provide equal opportunities for academic growth. Qualified and dedicated teachers volunteer their time to deliver high-quality education to students, helping them build a strong foundation of knowledge and skills.

Madhav Sewa Society strongly believes in the spirit of inclusivity and unity. The organization celebrates all festivals, regardless of religious or cultural backgrounds, promoting harmony and respect among community members. Through festive celebrations, they create an environment that fosters understanding, empathy, and appreciation for diversity. These events bring together individuals from different walks of life, promoting social cohesion and spreading joy and happiness among participants.

Madhav Sewa Society encourages individuals who share their passion for helping others to join their volunteer program. Volunteers play a vital role in the organization\'s activities, contributing their time, skills, and compassion to make a difference in the lives of those in need. The organization also welcomes donations from generous individuals and organizations, which help sustain and expand their initiatives, reach a wider audience, and make a greater impact.

Madhav Sewa Society believes that collective efforts can bring about significant change. By focusing on the empowerment of disabled individuals and providing free tuition classes to children, they are building a strong foundation for a more inclusive and educated society. Their dedication to celebrate all festivals promotes unity and understanding, fostering an environment of harmony and acceptance. Madhav Sewa Society invites everyone to join hands and contribute to their noble cause, creating a brighter future for all.

-> Vivek Joshi is an extraordinary individual who has shown remarkable resilience and compassion in the face of personal adversity. Despite facing his own disabilities, he has dedicated his life to make a positive impact in the lives of others. Vivek is the founder and driving force behind the NGO called Madhav Sewa Society, which is committed to assisting disabled individuals and promoting their overall well-being.

-> With an unwavering determination, Vivek has transformed his personal challenges into a source of inspiration for others. Through Madhav Sewa Society, he strives to empower disabled individuals by providing them with access to essential resources, support, and opportunities. The NGO focuses on various aspects of disabled persons\' lives, including education, healthcare, vocational training, and employment assistance. Vivek\'s ultimate goal is to ensure that every disabled individual receives equal opportunities and is able to lead a fulfilling and independent life.

-> Vivek\'s passion for making a difference extends beyond his own work. His mother, too, has been recognized for her remarkable contributions. She received the iconic Mother Award from the President of India, which is a testament to her love, care, and dedication towards her family and the larger community. This recognition showcases the values instilled in Vivek by his mother and the impact of her upbringing in shaping him into the compassionate and determined individual he is today.

-> Vivek Joshi\'s story serves as an inspiration to all, demonstrating the power of resilience, empathy, and the ability to create change. Through his NGO, he continues to make a lasting impact on the lives of disabled individuals, fostering inclusivity, and championing their rights. Vivek\'s remarkable journey and the recognition he has received are a testament to his indomitable spirit and unwavering dedication to the cause of disability empowerment.

-> Vivek\'s efforts and dedication have been widely recognized and applauded. He has been honored with numerous awards for his exceptional work in the field of disability rights and welfare. His book Lafz Lafz Massom was released by the Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam, late former President of India ang got honored by him. He also got National Award from Former President Sh. Pranav Mukherjee
